dji.sdk.api.GroundStation

Class DJIGroundStationTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.GroundStation.DJIGroundStationTask

  • public class DJIGroundStationTask
extends java.lang.Object

    DJI Ground Station Task

    A ground station task is a series of waypoints, each waypoint representing a physical location, for the aircraft to traverse. It is used to add, remove and modify waypoints.
    The Phantom 2 Series only allows 16 waypoints to be added to each task, while the Inspire 1 and Phantom 3 Series allows 99 waypoints. Some of the attributes in this class cannot be set for the Phantom 2 Series.
    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software
    See Also:
    DJIGroundStationWaypoint

    • Field Detail

      • wayPointCount

        public int wayPointCount
        Number of waypoints in the ground station task. In other words, the number of waypoints in the ArrayList mWaypointsList.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

      • startWaypointIndex

        public int startWaypointIndex
        Supported only by the Phantom 2 Series
        Index of the first waypoint in mWaypointsList.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

      • mWaypointsList

        public java.util.ArrayList<DJIGroundStationWaypoint> mWaypointsList
        ArrayList of waypoints in the task.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

      • isLoop

        public boolean isLoop
        Determines whether the ground station task will execute in a loop. Default value is false.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

      • repeatNum

        public int repeatNum
        How many times the ground station task will be repeated, meaning that if repeatNum is 1, the aircraft will return to the first waypoint after finishing the task, and repeat the task once more.
        Default value is 0. Range is [0, 255].
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

      • movingMode

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJIGroundStationMovingMode movingMode
        Supported only by the Inspire 1 and Phantom 3 Series
        The heading of the aircraft as it moves between waypoints. Default is GSHeadingTowardNextWaypoint.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

      • finishAction

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJIGroundStationFinishAction finishAction
        Supported only by the Inspire 1 and Phantom 3 Series
        The action the aircraft will take after completing the last waypoint. Default is none.

      • pathMode

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJIGroundStationPathMode pathMode
        Supported only by the Inspire 1 and Phantom 3 Series
        What type of path is generated for the aircraft to follow. Path can either be generated by connecting adjacent waypoints with straight lines, or with smooth curves. Default is Point_To_Point.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

      • remoteControlSpeed

        public float remoteControlSpeed
        Supported only by the Inspire 1 and Phantom 3 Series
        While the drone is travelling between waypoints, you can offset its speed by pushing up or down of the remote controller stick. remoteControlSpeed sets the maximum value of the offset.
        For example, if remoteControlSpeed is set to 10.0m/s, pushing the remote controller stick up all the way will add 10.0m/s to the drone's speed, while pushing downwards will subtract 10.0m/s.
        If the remote controller stick is not pushed all the way, the speed added will be calculated based on a mapping from [0, remoteControlSpeed] to [0, 1000], where [0, 1000] represents a range the distinct angles the remote controller stick can be pushed to.
        This allows the drone to have a negative speed. When this happens, the drone will move backwards along its flight path, towards the previous waypoint. If it reaches the starting waypoint, it will hover in position until its speed is a positive value again.
        The range is [2.0, 10.0]. Units are in meters per second.

      • movingSpeed

        public float movingSpeed
        Supported only by the Inspire 1 and Phantom 3 Series
        The base speed, in meters, of the aircraft as it moves between waypoints. The aircraft's actual speed is calculated by factoring in whether the remote controller stick is being pushed by the pilot, and remoteControllerSpeed. If movingSpeed is set to 0, the aircraft's speed will be controlled purely by the pilot.
        Setting movingSpeed to a negative value will cause the drone to stay still when the ground station task starts, until the speed is made positive by using the remote controller.
        Range is [-15, 15]. Units are in meters per second.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

    • Constructor Detail

      • DJIGroundStationTask

        public DJIGroundStationTask()
        DJIGroundStationTask() constructor function.

        Post Condition:
        A DJIGroundStationTask object will be created, with a new empty DJIGroundStationWaypoint ArrayList for mWaypointsList.

        Defaults:
        wayPointCount = 0
        startWaypointIndex = 0
        movingMode = GSHeadingTowardNextWaypoint
        finishAction = None
        pathMode = Point_To_Point
        RemoteControlSpeed = 5.0
        movingSpeed = 3.0

    • Method Detail

      • getWayPointCount

        int The number of waypoints in the task

      • getStartWaypointIndex

        public int getStartWaypointIndex()
        Returns startWaypointIndex, the index of the waypoint the aircraft will begin its task at.
        Returns:
        int startWaypointIndex
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

      • setStartWaypointIndex

        public void setStartWaypointIndex(int index)
        Supported only by the Phantom 2 Series
        Sets startWaypointIndex, the index of the waypoint the aircraft will begin its task at.

        Precondition:
        There is a waypoint at the specified index.

        Post Condition:
        When the task is started, the aircraft will begin by flying to the waypoint set as the starting waypoint. The aircraft will always traverse all the waypoints. For example, if I have waypoints indexed 0 to 5, and my starting waypoint is 2, after traversing waypoints 2 through 5, the aircraft will traverse waypoints 0 and 1.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the waypoint to set as the starting waypoint
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

      • setLoop

        public void setLoop(boolean loop)
        Sets isLoop, a boolean which controls whether the ground station task will execute in a loop.

        Post Condition:
        If isLoop is set to true, every time the drone completes the last waypoint, it will return to the first waypoint and start the task over.
        Parameters:
        loop - True for looping. False for one time execution.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

      • addWaypoint

        public void addWaypoint(DJIGroundStationWaypoint waypoint)
        Adds a waypoint to the ground station task. Waypoints are added to the ArrayList mWaypointsList. The maximum number of waypoints allowed for the Inspire 1 and Phantom 3 Series is 99. The maximum number of waypoints allowed for the Phantom 2 Series is 16.
        Parameters:
        waypoint - Waypoint to be added to the ground station task.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

      • insertWaypoint

        public void insertWaypoint(DJIGroundStationWaypoint waypoint,
                           int index)
        Inserts a waypoint into the ArrayList mWaypointsList at the specified index.

        Precondition:
        Index must be less than the current size of the waypoint list.
        Parameters:
        waypoint - Waypoint to be inserted into the ground station task.
        index - Index where the waypoint should be inserted.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

      • RemoveAllWaypoint

        public void RemoveAllWaypoint()
        Removes all waypoints from the ground station task.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

        Removes the waypoint at the index from the waypoint list.

        Precondition:

        Parameters:
        index - The index of the waypoint to be removed

        Parameters:
